column1: The names Aredhel and Ar-Feiniel ("noble white lady") were both originally intended to stand alone
column2: and be used as the main name of IrissÃ«. While preparing The Silmarillion for publication Christopher Tolkien could not discover which name was intended to be used as her final name
column3: and he therefore chose to use both names: a decision he later stated in The History of Middle-earth series was possibly mistaken.

column1: An earlier version of her name was Isfin.
